sources.title: The House of Seven Corpses (1973) Eight graves! Seven bodies! One killer... and he's already dead.
sources.description:
A film crew, led by Eric, shoots a horror movie in a cursed mansion where the lines between fiction and reality blur as cast members start dying mysteriously. As tensions rise, the crew realizes they’ve awakened something sinister tied to the house’s dark history.

Director: Paul Harrison
Writers: Paul Harrison, Thomas J. Kelly
Stars: John Ireland, Faith Domergue, John Carradine, Carole Wells
Release date: 12 December 1973 (USA)
Genre: Horror


00:00 - Full movie with subtitles
02:05 - A film crew arrives at the eerie Beal Mansion to shoot a horror movie, unaware of its sinister history.
12:45 - Director Eric Hartman argues with Gayle Dorian over her performance, as tensions rise on set.
25:30 - David reads from the Book of the Dead, unknowingly summoning a dark force within the mansion.
38:10 - Caretaker Edgar warns the crew about the mansion's cursed past, but his words are dismissed.
50:55 - A séance goes horribly wrong, unleashing supernatural chaos that terrifies the crew.
1:03:20 - Gayle encounters a ghostly figure in the crypt, leading to a shocking and deadly discovery.
1:15:40 - The undead rise, attacking the crew as they desperately try to escape the mansion's horrors.
1:18:10 - In a chilling climax, the true killer is revealed, and the mansion claims its final victim.

@CultCinemaClassics 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

metadata.Plot: A director is filming on location in a house where seven murders were committed. The caretaker warns them not to mess with things they do not understand (the murders were occult related), but the director wants to be as authentic as possible and has his cast re-enact rituals that took place in the house thus summoning a ghoul from the nearby cemetery to bump the whole film crew off one by one.
metadata.Actors: John Ireland, Faith Domergue, John Carradine
